result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard L. Burckhardt

defendant.name: Burckhardt, Richard L.
defendant.address: W4466 Duck Creek Ln, Westfield, WI 53964

records.addlTxt:
2:44 PM Defendant Richard L. Burckhardt appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by phone for Richard L. Burckhardt.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
2022TR001036, 2022TR001037 tracking with 22CF94:
Atty Gumz has an offer from the State; needs further time to review with his client.  Atty Gumz asks for a Prelim or status to be set. Atty Juech has no objection to a status being set.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on December 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:35 AM Defendant Richard L. Burckhardt appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Richard L. Burckhardt.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
2022TR001036, 2022TR001037 tracking with 22CF94:
Atty Gumz did receive Discovery but didn't get that to his client until last week.  Atty Gumz requests a Preliminary Hearing or another status date.

BY THE COURT:  Set another status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
*No contact with Victim 1, the victim's family or the victim's residence

8:39 AM Defendant Richard L. Burckhardt in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz in court for Richard L. Burckhardt.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of the time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 

Atty Gumz states that there is an agreement to modify the cash bond to a $500 cash bond with the same conditions.  Atty Juech is in agreement with the amended cash.

BY THE COURT:  Cash bond will be amended to a $500 cash bond with the same conditions.
*No contact with Victim 1, the victim's family or the victim's residence
Status hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status hearing on September 26, 2022 at 11:45 am.

10:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard L. Burckhardt appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Richard L. Burckhardt. 
2022TR001036, 2022TR001037 tracking with 22CF94:
Atty Gumz states that he was just appointed on the case and has not been able to speak with the defendant; requests a breakout room.  

BACK ON THE RECORD - 10:19am 
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Gumz did receive the amended complaint.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  set Prelim; time limits not waived
Court enters  NG plea on the traffic matters
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No contact with Victim 1, the victim's family or the victim's residence

3:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard L. Burckhardt appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Diana Van Rybroek appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Atty Burdon filed an amended criminal complaint as well.  Atty Burdon requests a $25,000 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Van Rybroek asks for a breakout room.  BACK ON THE RECORD:  Atty Van Rybroek makes bail arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $10,000 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No contact with Victim 1, the victim's family or the victim's residence
Initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
